description: some sort of decorative patch
some sort of decorative patch made of plastic
some sort of decorative patch made of woven cotton
some sort of decorative patch made of leather
some sort of decorative patch made of nylon
Polymer patch with a dark background and light text which says ".22LR" in large letters.
Polymer patch with a dark background and light text which says "5.56" in large letters.
Polymer patch with a dark background and light text which says "9mm" in large letters.
Polymer patch with a dark background and light text which says ".45ACP" in large letters.
Polymer patch with a dark background and light text which says "C4" in large letters.
Leather shield patch portraying tall mountain peeks.
Head of a cartoonish clown with green hair, crossed out inside a red circle.
Round orange patch with a red firefighter's helmet inside a dark-orange circle.
Shield leather patch portrayng an star-spangled eagle flying up and to the right.
Big round yellow smiley face.
Two-tone square of a folded American flag.
The famous cartoon by Benjamin Franklin, depicting the then-separate American colonies of the East Coast as a chopped snake, drawn as a call for unification and independence.
A parody of the famous political cartoon by Benjamin Franklin, it depicts a slice of pizza being cut into four, length-wise.
The sight of a golden Spartan helmet, in profile, within a circle with a ribbed border.

name.str: MOLLE patch: Smoke 'Em if You Got 'Em

description: Outlined M8 smoke grenade, with the words "SMOKE 'EM IF YOU GOT 'EM" on the grenade's body.
Round patch centered around a cup of coffee made to look like skull, with the words "COFFEE, THEN CONQUER" above it.
The Stars and Stripes inside a thick black outline.
The flag of Puerto Rico: five horizontal lines alternating between red and white, covered from the left by a triangle facing east, in the center of which is a big white star.
The flag of Texas: thick blue stripe with centered white star on the left, and a horizontal white line on top of a red line on the right.
The flag of Chicago: three white bars, two bars of light blue. This one has four six-angled stars on it.
The flag of Chicago: three white bars, two bars of light blue. This one has five six-angled stars on it.
Medium-length red nylon patch. Designed to be written on and attached to pouches to distinguish different kinds of equipment carried inside.
